STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
December 1, 2023
Jennifer LYNN Shores
SAGINAW COUNTY DHHS
411 E GENESEE AVE,
SAGINAW, MI, 48607-1254
Re: License #: CP730201395
Dear Jennifer LYNN Shores:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
11/09/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement
(4) If an emergency change in placement is necessary,
then all the documentation required in subrules (2) and
(3) of this rule must be in the child’s record within 14
calendar days after the change in placement.
One of the eight child foster care records indicated the foster child had a change in
placement effective 7/17/2023 that was not documented until 8/18/2023 which is
outside the 14 day time period established by this rule.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Discussed Medical Passport expectations.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• None
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
2

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. A
corrective action plan was submitted for the renewal evaluation completed
9/6/2022. Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of that review were Rules
324(4)(b)(d), 327(4)(5)(d)(6)(a)(b)(c), 418(1)(2)(a), 504(1)(2)(f), 511 (1)(a)(b)(c)(d)
(2)(a)(b)(c)(d), FOM 801-03, and FOM 722-6B. None of these were identified as
repeat noncompliance as a part of this interim review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment report was a review of the CAP for the
noncompliance identified in the renewal evaluation completed 9/06/2022. It also
included a review of the agency's key performance indicators.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff and Youth Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. Staff comments
were positive, and no concerns were reported.
The youth interviews with the analyst were positive and indicated appropriate
support/services are being provided.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is well maintained and the records storage is consistent with
compliance with licensing rules.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The analyst identified 2 safety alerts. Both involved relative homes. They were
resolved and documentation of resolution was received and approved. Comments
from caregivers and youth were positive and indicated appropriate support/services
are being provided.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
3
